Kemendagri Akan Cabut Izin 4 Desa 'Hantu' Penyedot Dana Desa
05 Nov 2019, 09:14 by Hendra Kusuma


Ilustrasi Desa 'Hantu' (Foto: Angling Adhitya P/detikcom)

Jakarta - Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri) memastikan akan mencabut izin empat desa 'hantu' yang selama ini berhasil menikmati aliran uang program dana desa. Sebanyak empat desa tak fiktif ini seluruhnya berada di Sulawesi Tenggara.Dirjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa Kemendagri, Nata Irawan mengatakan pihaknya sudah meminta kepada Pemerintah Daerah (Pemda) setempat untuk mencabut izin pembentukan desa tersebut."Ini sudah kami komunikasikan dengan Pemda dan bahkan kami meminta untuk usul pencabutan," kata Nata saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Nata menjelaskan, keempat desa fiktif ini juga sudah diketahui menikmati aliran dana desa setelah tim khusus Ditjen Bina Pemerintahan Desa turun lapangan pada seminggu yang lalu. Adapun, laporan tersebut awalnya berasal dari Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK)."Ini sedang kami komunikasikan dengan Bupati dengan Gubernur, kita akan mengambil langkah-langkah administrasi dan hukum untuk menyelesaikan," jelasnya.Dapat diketahui, Kementerian Keuangan mengalokasikan anggaran dana desa sebesar Rp 70 triliun di tahun 2019. Indonesia memiliki 74.597 desa di 2019, di mana setiap desa mendapatkan anggaran sekitar Rp 900 juta.Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa saat ini banyak muncul desa 'hantu' atau desa-desa baru yang tidak berpenghuni. Desa tersebut muncul tiba-tiba demi mendapatkan alokasi anggaran program dana desa yang sudah dijalankan Pemerintah.Hal itu diungkapkannya saat melaporkan evaluasi kinerja APBN Tahun Anggaran 2019 di ruang rapat Komisi XI dewan Perwakilan Rakyat (DPR), Jakarta Selatan."Sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang nggak ada penduduknya karena adanya dana desa," kata Sri Mulyani, Senin (4/11/2019). The Ministry of Home Affairs Will Revoke Licenses of 4 'Ghost' Village Village Suction Funds
05 Nov 2019, 09:14 by Hendra Kusuma


Illustration of 'Ghost' Village (Photo: Angling Adhitya P / detikcom)

Jakarta - The Ministry of Home Affairs (Kemendagri) has confirmed that it will revoke the licenses of four 'ghost' villages that have so far succeeded in enjoying the flow of money from the village fund program. A total of four of these fictitious villages are all in Southeast Sulawesi. Director General of Village Ministry of Home Affairs Development, Nata Irawan said that he had asked the local government (Pemda) to revoke the permit for the formation of the village. Revocation proposal, "Nata said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019). Nata explained that the four fictitious villages were also known to enjoy the flow of village funds after the special team of the Directorate General of Village Government took the field last week. Meanwhile, the report originally came from the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). "We are communicating this with the Regent and the Governor, we will take administrative and legal steps to resolve it," he explained. It is known, the Ministry of Finance allocates a village budget of Rp. 70 trillion in 2019. Indonesia has 74,597 villages in 2019, where each village receives a budget of around Rp 900 million. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed that currently there are many 'ghost' villages or new uninhabited villages. The village appeared suddenly in order to get the budget allocation of the village fund program that has been run by the Government. It was expressed when reporting the evaluation of the 2019 Budget Year State Budget performance in the Commission XI meeting room of the House of Representatives (DPR), South Jakarta. there are no new residents due to village funds, "Sri Mulyani said, Monday (11/04/2019).
